Package com.globaltcad.swingtree

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.globaltcad.swingtree.UI
  • public final class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a static API for exposing swing tree builder types for wrapping and assembling various JComponent types to form a UI tree. Instances of these builder type expose an API based on chained methods designed around functional interfaces to enable building UI tree structures for Swing in an HTML-like nested fashion while also keeping a high degree of control and transparency by peeking into the underlying swing components or registering user actions through lambdas. Swing tree works especially well alongside MigLayouts, which is why this general purpose LayoutManager is integrated into this library. Simply pass String constraints to the UIForAbstractSwing.withLayout(String, String) and any given UIForAbstractSwing.add(String, UIForAbstractSwing[]) method or variant of, to make use of mig layouts.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  UI.Align
      Vertical or horizontal alignment.
      static class  UI.Cursor
      An enum set of all the available swing cursors which map to the cursor type id.
      static class  UI.HorizontalAlignment
      Different positions along a horizontally aligned UI component.
      static class  UI.HorizontalDirection  
      static class  UI.OverflowPolicy
      Overflow policy of UI components.
      static class  UI.Position
      The position of a UI component in terms of directions.
      static class  UI.ScrollBarPolicy
      The scroll policy for UI components with scroll behaviour.
      static class  UI.TestWindow
      Use this to quickly create and inspect a tes window for a UI component.
      static class  UI.VerticalAlignment
      Different positions along a vertically aligned UI component.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static <T extends javax.swing.JComponent> UIForSwing<T> of​(T component)
        This returns an instance of a generic swing tree builder for anything extending the JComponent class.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The concrete type of this new component.
        Parameters:
        component - The new component instance which ought to be part of the Swing UI.
        Returns:
        A basic UI builder instance wrapping any JComponent.

      • of

        public static <T extends javax.swing.JComponent> UIForSwing<T> of​(SwingBuilder<T> builder)
        If you are using builders for your custom JComponent, implement this to allow the UI API to call the SwingBuilder.build() method for you.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The UI component type built by implementations of the provided builder.
        Parameters:
        builder - A builder for custom JComponent types.
        Returns:
        A basic UI builder instance wrapping any JComponent.

      • of

        public static <M extends javax.swing.JMenuItem> UIForMenuItem<M> of​(MenuBuilder<M> builder)
        If you are using builders for custom JMenuItem components, implement this to allow the UI API to call the SwingBuilder.build() method for you.
        Type Parameters:
        M - The JMenuItem type built by implementations of the provided builder.
        Parameters:
        builder - A builder for custom JMenuItem types.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a JMenuItem, which enables fluent method chaining.

        Returns:
        A builder instance for a JButton, which enables fluent method chaining.

        Returns:
        A builder instance for a JButton, which enables fluent method chaining.

                                                      int height,
                                                      javax.swing.ImageIcon icon,
                                                      javax.swing.ImageIcon onHover)

      • button

        public static UIForButton<javax.swing.JButton> button​(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                                                      javax.swing.Icon onHover,
                                                      javax.swing.Icon onPress)
        Use this to create a builder for the JButton UI component with a default, an on-hover and an on-press icon displayed on top. This is in essence a convenience method for: 
        
      UI.of(new JButton()).peek( it -> {
          it.setIcon(icon);
          it.setRolloverIcon(onHover);
          it.setPressedIcon(onPress);
      })
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a JButton, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • of

        public static <B extends com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JSplitButton> UIForSplitButton<B> of​(B splitButton)

      • splitButton

        public static UIForSplitButton<com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JSplitButton> splitButton​(java.lang.String text)
        Use this to build JSplitButtons with custom text displayed ont top. The JSplitButton wrapped by the returned builder can be populated with JMenuItems like so: 
        
      UI.splitButton("Displayed on button!")
      .add(UI.splitItem("first"))
      .add(UI.splitItem("second").onButtonClick( it -> ... ))
      .add(UI.splitItem("third"))
        Parameters:
        text - The text which should be displayed on the wrapped JSplitButton
        Returns:
        A UI builder instance wrapping a JSplitButton.

      • splitItem

        public static SplitItem<javax.swing.JMenuItem> splitItem​(java.lang.String text)
        Use this to add entries to the JSplitButton by passing SplitItem instances to UIForSplitButton builder like so: 
        
      UI.splitButton("Button")
      .add(UI.splitItem("first"))
      .add(UI.splitItem("second"))
      .add(UI.splitItem("third"))
        You can also use the SplitItem wrapper class to wrap useful action lambdas for the split item.
        Parameters:
        text - The text displayed on the JMenuItem exposed by the JSplitButtons JPopupMenu.
        Returns:
        A new SplitItem wrapping a simple JMenuItem.

      • splitRadioItem

        public static SplitItem<javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem> splitRadioItem​(java.lang.String text)
        Use this to add radio item entries to the JSplitButton by passing SplitItem instances to UIForSplitButton builder like so: 
        
      UI.splitButton("Button")
      .add(UI.splitRadioItem("first"))
      .add(UI.splitRadioItem("second"))
      .add(UI.splitRadioItem("third"))
        You can also use the SplitItem wrapper class to wrap useful action lambdas for the split item.
        Parameters:
        text - The text displayed on the JRadioButtonMenuItem exposed by the JSplitButtons JPopupMenu.
        Returns:
        A new SplitItem wrapping a simple JRadioButtonMenuItem.

      • of

        public static <P extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane> UIForTabbedPane<P> of​(P pane)

      • tabbedPane

        public static UIForTabbedPane<javax.swing.JTabbedPane> tabbedPane()
        Use this to create a builder for a new JTabbedPane UI component. This is in essence a convenience method for UI.of(new JTabbedPane()). In order to add tabs to this builder use the tab object returned by tab(String) like so: 
        
      UI.tabbedPane()
      .add(UI.tab("one").add(UI.panel().add(..)))
      .add(UI.tab("two").withTip("I give info!").add(UI.label("read me")))
      .add(UI.tab("three").with(someIcon).add(UI.button("click me")))
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a new JTabbedPane, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • tabbedPane

        public static UIForTabbedPane<javax.swing.JTabbedPane> tabbedPane​(UI.Position tabsPosition)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JTabbedPane UI component with the provided UI.Position applied to the tab buttons (see JTabbedPane.setTabLayoutPolicy(int)). In order to add tabs to this builder use the tab object returned by tab(String) like so: 
        
      UI.tabbedPane(Position.RIGHT)
      .add(UI.tab("first").add(UI.panel().add(..)))
      .add(UI.tab("second").withTip("I give info!").add(UI.label("read me")))
      .add(UI.tab("third").with(someIcon).add(UI.button("click me")))
        Parameters:
        tabsPosition - The position of the tab buttons which may be UI.Position.TOP, UI.Position.RIGHT, UI.Position.BOTTOM, UI.Position.LEFT.
        Returns:
        A builder instance wrapping a new JTabbedPane, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tabsPosition is null.

      • tabbedPane

        public static UIForTabbedPane<javax.swing.JTabbedPane> tabbedPane​(UI.Position tabsPosition,
                                                                  UI.OverflowPolicy tabsPolicy)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JTabbedPane UI component with the provided UI.OverflowPolicy and UI.Position applied to the tab buttons (see JTabbedPane.setTabLayoutPolicy(int) and JTabbedPane.setTabPlacement(int)). In order to add tabs to this builder use the tab object returned by tab(String) like so: 
        
      UI.tabbedPane(Position.LEFT, OverflowPolicy.WRAP)
      .add(UI.tab("First").add(UI.panel().add(..)))
      .add(UI.tab("second").withTip("I give info!").add(UI.label("read me")))
      .add(UI.tab("third").with(someIcon).add(UI.button("click me")))
        Parameters:
        tabsPosition - The position of the tab buttons which may be UI.Position.TOP, UI.Position.RIGHT, UI.Position.BOTTOM, UI.Position.LEFT.
        tabsPolicy - The overflow policy of the tab buttons which can either be UI.OverflowPolicy.SCROLL or UI.OverflowPolicy.WRAP.
        Returns:
        A builder instance wrapping a new JTabbedPane, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tabsPosition or tabsPolicy are null.

      • tabbedPane

        public static UIForTabbedPane<javax.swing.JTabbedPane> tabbedPane​(UI.OverflowPolicy tabsPolicy)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JTabbedPane UI component with the provided UI.OverflowPolicy applied to the tab buttons (see JTabbedPane.setTabLayoutPolicy(int)). In order to add tabs to this builder use the tab object returned by tab(String) like so: 
        
      UI.tabbedPane(OverflowPolicy.SCROLL)
      .add(UI.tab("First").add(UI.panel().add(..)))
      .add(UI.tab("second").withTip("I give info!").add(UI.label("read me")))
      .add(UI.tab("third").with(someIcon).add(UI.button("click me")))
        Parameters:
        tabsPolicy - The overflow policy of the tab button which can either be UI.OverflowPolicy.SCROLL or UI.OverflowPolicy.WRAP.
        Returns:
        A builder instance wrapping a new JTabbedPane, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tabsPolicy is null.

      • tab

        public static Tab tab​(java.lang.String title)
        Use this to add tabs to a JTabbedPane by passing Tab instances to UIForTabbedPane builder like so: 
        
      UI.tabbedPane()
      .add(UI.tab("First").add(UI.panel().add(..)))
      .add(UI.tab("second").withTip("I give info!").add(UI.label("read me")))
      .add(UI.tab("third").with(someIcon).add(UI.button("click me")))
        Parameters:
        title - The text displayed on the tab button.
        Returns:
        A Tab instance containing everything needed to be added to a JTabbedPane.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if title is null.

      • panel

        public static UIForPanel<javax.swing.JPanel> panel​(java.lang.String attr,
                                                   java.lang.String colConstraints)
        Use this to create a builder for the JPanel UI component. This is in essence a convenience method for UI.of(new JPanel()).withLayout(attr, layout).
        Parameters:
        attr - The layout attributes which will be passed to the MigLayout constructor as first argument.
        colConstraints - The layout which will be passed to the MigLayout constructor as second argument.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a new JPanel, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • scrollPane

        public static UIForScrollPane<javax.swing.JScrollPane> scrollPane()
        Use this to create a builder for a new JScrollPane UI component. This is in essence a convenience method for UI.of(new JScrollPane()).
        Her is an example of a simple scroll panel with a text area inside: 
        
      UI.scrollPane()
      .withScrollBarPolicy(UI.Scroll.NEVER)
      .add(UI.textArea("I am a text area with this text inside."))
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a new JScrollPane, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • of

        public static <P extends javax.swing.JSplitPane> UIForSplitPane<P> of​(P component)
        Use this to create a builder for the provided JSplitPane instance.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for the provided JSplitPane, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if component is null.

      • splitPane

        public static UIForSplitPane<javax.swing.JSplitPane> splitPane​(UI.Align align)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JSplitPane instance based on the provided split alignment.
        You can create a simple split pane based UI like so: 
        
      UI.splitPane(UI.Align.HORIZONTAL)
      .withDividerAt(50)
      .add(UI.panel().add(...)) // top
      .add(UI.scrollPane().add(...)) // bottom
        Parameters:
        align - The alignment determining if the JSplitPane splits vertically or horizontally.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for the provided JSplitPane, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if align is null.

        public static UIForSlider<javax.swing.JSlider> slider​(UI.Align align)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JSlider instance based on tbe provided alignment type determining if the slider will be aligned vertically or horizontally.

        See Also:

      • slider

        public static UIForSlider<javax.swing.JSlider> slider​(UI.Align align,
                                                      int min,
                                                      int max)
        Use this to create a builder for a new JSlider instance based on tbe provided alignment type, min slider value and max slider value.
        Parameters:
        align - The alignment determining if the JSlider aligns vertically or horizontally.
        min - The minimum possible value of the slider.
        max - The maximum possible value of the slider.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for the provided JSlider, which enables fluent method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if align is null.
        See Also:
        JSlider.setOrientation(int), JSlider.setMinimum(int), JSlider.setMaximum(int)

      • slider

        public static UIForSlider<javax.swing.JSlider> slider​(UI.Align align,
                                                      int min,
                                                      int max,
                                                      int value)
        Creates a slider with the specified alignment and the specified minimum, maximum, and initial values.
        Parameters:
        align - The alignment determining if the JSlider aligns vertically or horizontally.
        min - The minimum possible value of the slider.
        max - The maximum possible value of the slider.
        value - the initial value of the slider
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if align is null.
        See Also:
        JSlider.setOrientation(int), JSlider.setMinimum(int), JSlider.setMaximum(int), JSlider.setValue(int)

      • textArea

        public static UIForTextArea<javax.swing.JTextArea> textArea​(java.lang.String text)

      • textArea

        public static UIForTextArea<javax.swing.JTextArea> textArea​(UI.HorizontalDirection direction)
        A convenience method for creating a builder for a JTextArea with a certain text alignment. This is a shortcut version for the following code: 
        
      UI.textArea()
          .withTextOrientation(UI.HorizontalDirection.RIGHT_TO_LEFT);
        The provided UI.HorizontalDirection translates to ComponentOrientation instances which are used to align the elements or text within the wrapped JTextComponent. LayoutManager and Component subclasses will use this property to determine how to lay out and draw components.
        Parameters:
        direction - The text orientation type which should be used.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a new JTextArea, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • textArea

        public static UIForTextArea<javax.swing.JTextArea> textArea​(UI.HorizontalDirection direction,
                                                            java.lang.String text)
        A convenience method for creating a builder for a JTextArea with a certain text and text alignment. This is a shortcut version for the following code: 
        
      UI.textArea()
          .withTextOrientation(UI.HorizontalDirection.RIGHT_TO_LEFT)
          .withText(text);
        The provided UI.HorizontalDirection translates to ComponentOrientation instances which are used to align the elements or text within the wrapped JTextComponent. LayoutManager and Component subclasses will use this property to determine how to lay out and draw components.
        Parameters:
        direction - The text orientation type which should be used.
        text - The new text to be set for the wrapped text component type.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for a new JTextArea, which enables fluent method chaining.

      • of

        public static <T> UIForAnything<T> of​(T component)
        Use this to create a builder for anything.
        Returns:
        A builder instance for the provided object, which enables fluent method chaining.
